translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.63. Sanidassanattika, Āsavavippayuttasāsavaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ sāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽āsavavippayutto nasāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sa ni dassana ttika āsava vippayutta sa āsava duka  anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayuttam sa āsavam dhammam paccayā na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  āsava vippayuttaḥ na sa āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayutta
translated: With-object-of-sense-desire, not-subject-to-cancelling, with- taints, in triads🔽With-object-of-sense-desire, not-subject-to-cancelling, with- taints, as condition, arises with-object-of-sense-desire, not- subject-to-cancelling, without- taints, …

original: sāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naanidassanasappaṭigho āsavavippayutto nasāsavo dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ sāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽āsavavippayutto nasāsavo ca naanidassanasappaṭigho āsavavippayutto nasāsavo ca dhammā
analyzed: sa āsavam dhammam paccayā na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ āsava vippayuttaḥ na sa āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayuttam sa āsavam dhammam paccayā na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  āsava vippayuttaḥ na sa asavaḥ ca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ āsava vippayuttaḥ na sa asavaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With-object-of-sense-desire, not-subject-to-cancelling, with- taints, as condition, arises without-object-of-sense-desire, not- subject-to-cancelling, without- taints, …🔽With-object-of-sense-desire, not-subject-to-cancelling, with- taints, as condition, arises with-object-of-sense-desire, not- subject-to-cancelling, without- taints, and without-object-of-sense-desire, not-subject-to-cancelling, without- taints, …🔽(In brief) …

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayuttam anāsavam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With an object that is not visible and has no impact, and which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless, there is an object that is not visible and has no impact,🔽which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless. With an object that is not visible and has no impact, and which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless, there is an object that is visible and has impact,

original: āsavavippayutto naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ
analyzed: āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayutta
translated: which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless. With an object that is not visible and has no impact, and which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless, there is an object that is visible and has impact,

original: anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho āsavavippayutto naanāsavo dhammo
analyzed: anāsavam dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ dhammo
translated: which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless, and an object that is not visible and has no impact,🔽which is unconnected with the taints and is taintless. (In brief.)

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavavippayuttaṁ anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho āsavavippayutto naanāsavo ca naanidassanasappaṭigho🔽āsavavippayutto naanāsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā🔽cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā pe anidassana appaṭigham āsava vippayuttam anāsavam dhamma 🔽paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ ca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ 🔽āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā 🔽cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to cause, there are six; with respect to predominance, there are six; … with respect to non-hindrance, there are six.
